bioghist.p: Herbert D. Valentine (b. 1935) was the Moderator of the General Assembly of the Presbyterian Church (U.S.A.) in 1991 and Executive Presbyter of the Presbytery of Baltimore. Valentine received a B.D. from San Francisco Theological Seminary in 1960, He was the pastor of Troub Memorial United Presbyterian Church in Indianapolis from 1961-1970 and the First Presbyterian Church, Gary, Indiana, from 1970-1977. In 1974, Valentine earned a D. Min. from McCormick Theological Seminary. After serving as Moderator, he founded and served as first president of the Interfaith Alliance. He retired in 2000.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Rev. Herbert D. Valentine during his service as Moderator of the General Assembly. The bulk of the collection consists of correspondence between Valentine and church members and officials. Many of the letters contain comments upon various positions of and statements issued by the General Assembly, most notably a statement on human sexuality issued in 1991. Other topics of discussion include the ordination of a practicing lesbian, the issue of abortion, a "smudging" ceremony conducted at the opening worship service of the 1991 General Assembly, and the decline in the membership of the Church. The collection also includes newsletters and articles on the General Assembly meeting in Baltimore.
